medical_history.chief_complaint: Heart failure in a 4-month-old boy with congenital heart defects.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began shortly after corrective surgery for a complete atrioventricular septal defect with initial respiratory infection. Postoperative complications included worsening respiratory distress, readmission for severe heart failure 2 weeks later, without fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital atrioventricular septal defect; previous respiratory infection with pleural effusion.
medical_history.family_history: Diarrhea episode in a 5-year-old brother a week prior to patient's readmission.
